greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1, a(prime(i)) = i + 1 for i > 0 and a(u * v) = a(u) * a(v) for u, v > 0; prime = A000040.
comment: a(n) <= n for all n and a(x) = x iff x = 2^i * 3^j for i, j >= 0: a(A003586(n)) = A003586(n) for n > 0. By definition a is completely multiplicative and also surjective. a(p) < a(q) for primes p < q.
Completely multiplicative with a(prime(i)) = i + 1. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 07 2012
a(A080688(n,k)) = A080444(n,k) = n for k=1..A001055(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 01 2012
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8000
T. D. Noe, Plot of A064553
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
formula: Let the prime factorization of n be p1^e1...pk^ek, then a(n) = (pi(p1)+1)^e1...(pi(pk)+1)^ek, where pi(p) is the index of prime p. - _T. D. Noe_, Dec 12 2004
mathematica: nn=100; a=Table[0, {nn}]; a[[1]]=1; Do[If[PrimeQ[i], a[[i]]=PrimePi[i]+1, p=FactorInteger[i][[1,1]]; a[[i]] = a[[p]]*a[[i/p]]], {i, 2, nn}]; a (* _T. D. Noe_, Dec 12 2004, revised Sep 27 2011 *)
Array[Apply[Times, Flatten@ Map[ConstantArray[#1, #2] & @@ # &, FactorInteger[ #]] /. p_ /; PrimeQ@ p :> PrimePi@ p + 1] &, 74] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 22 2017 *)
program: (Scheme) (define (A064553 n) (if (= 1 n) n (* (+ 1 (A055396 n)) (A064553 (A032742 n))))) ;; _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 22 2017
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 21 2001
